page.title: 19SPYNIE LEGEND LOSSIEMOUTH
page.content: In the southern part of our block there used to be a loch called Loch Spynie. A ferry used to cross where the Salterhills farm is now. The loch was drained just over one hundred and fifty years ago by the famous Scottish engineer, Thomas Telford. Now it is just marshy ground. Perhaps it would have been better left as a loch. {The Legend Scotland has many legends-Morayshire has some of its own. The legend of Sir Robert Gordon and the Devil has been passed down by word of mouth for three centuries. One misty November day the Laird arranged to meet with his factor in Elgin. In order to get to Elgin he had to cross Loch Spynie by ferry or go all the way round past Duffus.
